definition: to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance

sentences.english: W1 So I have my initial state, my final state, W1 my initial state, my final state here.
sentences.chinese: 再加熱，做功，對系統做的總功是。

sentences.english: Well, remember in the case of work we had Green's theorem.
sentences.chinese: 請記得做功的例子，可以用格林公式的。

sentences.english: And so we have the work coming from two steps.
sentences.chinese: 因此我們把做功過程分成了兩步。

sentences.english: We have two theorems about work.
sentences.chinese: 關於做功，我們有兩個公式。

sentences.english: Is the normal force not doing any work?
So, the system does work on the surroundings, hence the minus sign.
sentences.chinese: 系統對環境做功，因此符號是負的。

sentences.english: If I take any closed curve, the work will always be zero.
sentences.chinese: 如果我取任意閉合曲線，所做功都全是。

sentences.english: The influences of the work done by electric field forces on the flow parameter are trivial.
sentences.chinese: 另外，電場力做功對流動參數的影響可以忽略。

sentences.english: There might be a mass here. This could be a car.
So, the work for this process is the integral, pdv or minus the integral, V1, V2, p dV.
sentences.chinese: 此過程中的做功等於負的積分，從v1到v2，外部。

sentences.english: mgh mgh Well, the amount of work that I do is mgh. mgh.
This more complicated construction is required in double-acting engines.
sentences.chinese: 這種非常複雜的結構多用於雙向做功的發動機。

sentences.english: And we will evaluate the line integral for work.
sentences.chinese: 爲了求做功，我們要計算線積分。

sentences.english: It's an expansion, so we're doing work against the environment, or to the environment.
sentences.chinese: 壓強降低，系統對，外界做功。

sentences.english: Did no work. Does that mean du is zero?
sentences.chinese: 沒有對外做功，這是否意味着du=0？

sentences.english: My dear younger brother idles his time away when he shall be doing his homework too.
sentences.chinese: 我親愛的弟弟該做功課時卻在胡混浪費時間。

definition: backwards and forwards action (e.g. of piston or pump)/reciprocating motion
cylinder (of steam engine or internal combustion engine)
conservation (e.g. of energy, momentum or heat in physics)/to remain constant (of a number)
